messages.message: We are sorry to tell that the system is out of order for the moment.
WORDFORM is not found in our lexicon. Could it be a typo?
WORDFORM should have initial capital letter?
WORDFORM has a typo?
WORDFORM is a misspelled illative?
You might have forgotten to write á in WORDFORM
Answering I-don't-know is too simple. Try again.

Are you confident that the pronounPronoun is inflected in person, e.g. mun, don, son, and in number if there are two or more persons: moai, doai, soai, mii, dii, sii. WORDFORM is in correct person and number?

Do you mean 1. person singular? WORDFORM should have consonant gradationAlternation in the consonant cluster, e.g. -idn- to -inn-. Click to read more.. finite verbA finite verb is inflected for person and number, e.g.: boran, lohká. Could there be a typo in your verbform?
"soaitit" should be used like other auxilary verbs, e.g. Mun soaittán boahtit.
WORDFORM shall not be a finite verbA finite verb is inflected for person and tense, e.g.: boran, lohká. Perhaps infinitiveThe base form, e.g.: borrat, lohkat is appropriate?
After "bargat" and "dahkat" another verb is not appropriate.
Answer with the same verb as in the question.
You must usenegation verbNegation verb is in, it, ii and so on. Click to read more..
You must use the given verb.
You must use the given noun.
You must use the given adjective.
You must use the given pronoun.
You must use the given numeral.
You must use the given postposition.
Remember to use locativeThe owner is in locative, and what one have, is in nominative: Mánás lea spábba. Click to read more..
WORDFORM should be in comitativeCase expressing "with": niibbiin, niibbiiguin. Click to read more..
WORDFORM should be in locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Click to read more..
In illative the vowel should changeThe last vowel changes because of the illative suffix: a > i, i > á, o > u. Click to read more..
WORDFORM is an illative, but the vowel should changeThe last vowel changes because of the illative suffix: a > i, i > á, o > u. Click to read more..
In comitative the vowel should changeThe last vowel changes because of the comitative suffix: e > i. Click to read more..
WORDFORM is comitative, but the vowel should changeThe last vowel changes because of the comitative suffix: e > i. Click to read more..
WORDFORM misses diphthong simplificationThe diphthong becomes a single vowel: ea - e, ie - i, uo - u, oa - o..
Misspelling, probably an incorrect illative. Click to read more.
WORDFORM is a misspelled illative? Click to read more.
The verbSome verbs, e.g. liikot, requires an illative: guollái, guliide. Click to read more. requires that WORDFORM should be in illative.
EssiveCase expressing "as": skuvlan, under what conditions something happens, or what something is called. Interrogates are: manin, geanin. Click to read more. does not fit here.
Postposition does not fit here.
Be sure that singular/plural match.
WORDFORM should be in 3rd person, singular or plural. Click to read more about have-sentences.
Are you confident that the verb WORDFORM is inflected correctly?
Remember agreement between subject and verbalThe verb is conjugated to correlate for person and number of the subject, e.g. Mun boađán. Click to read more..
Are you confident that you answer in the correct tense?
Here should be an actio essiveActio essive is e.g. 'lea boahtime/boahtimin'. Click to read more..

WORDFORM has wrong form. It comes after the negation verb and should have negation formNegation form in present tense is e.g. boađe, bora, goaro, in past tense: boahtán, borran, gorron. Click to read more..
WORDFORM should be infinitiveThe base form, e.g.: borrat, lohkat.
Two negation formsNegation form in present tense is e.g. boađe, bora, goaro, in past tense: boahtán, borran, gorron. Click to read more. are one too many.
WORDFORM is locative? Remember consonant gradationAlternation in the consonant cluster, e.g. -idn- to -inn-. Click to read more..
Remember consonant gradationAlternation in the consonant cluster, e.g. -idn- to -inn-. Click to read more..
Your answer should contain a numeral in singular.
Your answer should contain a numeral in plurale.g. guovttit gápmagat. Click to read more..
Your answer should contain a numeral in locative.
Your answer should contain a collective numeral or numeral in locative.
Your answer should contain an ordinal numbere.g. nubbi, goalmmát, njealját..
Are you confident that you answer with the correct case?
Your answer should contain an accusative Case for the object, e.g. girjji, girjjiid. Interrogates are: maid, man, gean, geaid. Click to read more. .
Remember that the whole object should be in accusative.

Your answer should contain a genitiveCase for the possessor: nissona, nissoniid. Also for the complement of post- and prepositions: nissona luhtte, and after numbers bigger than 1: golbma 'bártni'. Click to read more..
Your answer should contain a comitativeCase expressing "with": niibbiin, niibbiiguin. Interrogates are: mainna, maiguin, geainna, geaiguin. Click to read more..

Your answer should contain an illativeCase for motion toward or into something: skuvlii, skuvllaide, or for the receiver: áhkkui. Interrogates are: gosa, masa, maidda, geasa, geaidda. Click to read more..
Your answer should contain a locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Interrogates are: mas, main, gos. Click to read more..
The thing someone has, should be in nominativeThe one who has something, is in locative. The thing someone has, is in nominative: Mánás lea spábba. Click to read more..
Your answer should contain a nominativeCase given as the base form of the nouns, e.g. gussa, gusat. Interrogates are: mii, mat, gii, geat. Click to read more..
Your answer should contain an essiveCase expressing "as": skuvlan, under what conditions something happens, or what something is called. Interrogates are: manin, geanin. Click to read more...
The vehicle should be in comitativeCase expressing "with": biillain, biillaiguin. Click to read more..
Note that locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Interrogates are: mas, main, gos. Click to read more. means in or from the place.
Your answer should contain a locativeCase expressing at/in/on or from: skuvllas, skuvllain. Interrogates are: mas, main, gos. Click to read more..

Your answer should contain an illativeCase for motion toward or into something: skuvlii, skuvllaide, eller for mottaker: áhkkui. Interrogates are: gosa, masa, maidda, geasa, geaidda. Click to read more..
In front of a postposition the nominal should be in genitiveE.g.: máná luhtte, mánáid luhtte. Click to learn more..
WORDFORM should be in essiveCase expressing "as": skuvlan, under what conditions something happens, or what something is called. Interrogates are: manin, geanin. Click to read more.?

WORDFORM should be in genitiveCase for the possessor: nissona, nissoniid. Also for the complement of post- and prepositions: nissona luhtte, and after numbers bigger than 1: golbma 'bártni'. Click to read more.?
WORDFORM should be in nominativeCase given as the base form of the nouns, e.g. gussa, gusat. Interrogates are: mii, mat, gii, geat. Click to read more..
The object should be in pluralAccusative plural, e.g.: girjjiid, mánáid.
Are you confident that postposition fits the question?
Are you confident that postposition fits the question?
The object should be in accusativee.g. 'girjji', not 'girji'. Click to read more..
Would be better with a pronoun in front of the verb.
Remember "eret" after the placename.
Remember agreement between demonstrative pronoun and nounThe pronoun is declined for number and case according to the noun. Click to read more..
Remember agreement between subject and adjectiveE.g. when the noun is plural, the adjective should be in plural. Click to read more..
Remember agreement between numeral and nounIf the numeral is singular, the noun should be singular. The case of the numeral should agree with the case of the noun. Click to read more..
Remember agreement between "buorre" and the noun'buorre' is a special adjective which is declined also as attribute, e.g. 'buorit biktasat'. Click to read more..
WORDFORM should have had attribute formAdjective appears in attribute form when it premodifies a noun, e.g. 'rukses' instead of 'ruoksat'. Click to read more..
WORDFORM should not have had attribute formAdjective appears in attribute form when it premodifies a noun, e.g. 'rukses' instead of 'ruoksat'. Click to read more..
The time expression might perhaps not be appropriate here?
The time expression should perhaps not refer forward in time?
The time expression should perhaps not refer backwards in time?
"fal" cannot occur sentence-initially.
"na" can only occur sentence-initially.
WORDFORM is an interjectionword expressing emotion, e.g. gea, a-a, hei and can only occur sentence-initially or sentence-finally.
You must use one of the words in the wordlist in the left margin.
You have not used the appropriate adjective. Try again.
You have not used the appropriate form of the adjective. Try again.
Check the inflection of WORDFORM, it is following a numeralThe case of the numeral should agree with the case of the noun. Click to read more..
